sanskrit_verse: वार्षिकांश्चतुरो मासान् यथेन्द्रोऽभिप्रवर्षति । तथाऽभिवर्षेत्स्वं राष्ट्रं कामैरिन्द्रव्रतं चरन् ॥ ९.३०४॥
transliteration: vārṣikāṁś caturo māsān yathendro 'bhipravarṣati | tathā 'bhivarṣet svaṁ rāṣṭraṁ kāmair indravrataṁ caran || 9.304 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: As Indra showers rain for four months annually to sustain all beings, so shall the ruler nourish his kingdom perpetually through desire-free observance of Indra's vow.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is aligned with natural rhythm and cosmic duty
Causation flows from dharma-sustained action, not personal will
Capacity-based responsibility requires alignment with universal nourishment
Restoration logic mirrors ecological and spiritual abundance cycles
Consciousness alignment demands rulership free from craving
executable_legal_axioms: IF ruler governs without personal desire THEN governance aligns with Indra-vrata
IF kingdom lacks nourishment THEN ruler has failed in Indra-vrata observance
IF seasonal harmony reflects state integrity THEN ruler upholds dharma-vow
IF citizens’ needs unmet THEN review capacity-alignment of leadership protocols
supreme_court_application: Supreme judicial authority must assess whether executive actions reflect Indra-vrata adherence—measuring policy outcomes against non-desire-based societal nourishment metrics rather than political intent or economic gain.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that causal order follows vrata observance; anupūrvaśaḥ shows delayed consequences of desire-driven rule; proportional responsibility lies in restoring alignment with Indra’s rhythm; punitive measures are irrelevant where consciousness realignment restores systemic flow.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate vrata-realignment process for ruling entity
Establish dharmic audit mechanism based on seasonal welfare indicators
Reintegrate ruler's consciousness with cosmic nourishment cycle
Implement community feedback loops tied to resource distribution integrity
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this verse executes as eternal law: sovereignty derives from Indra-vrata observance, justice flows from consciousness alignment, and Dharma stands restored.
